intro: Psychotria viminea, commonly known as the creeping Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, dark green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow or orange corona. Psychotria viminea is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
